content.description:
Establish a belay using gear to 3 inches or sling the now-dead madrone (not recommended). From the top of the false summit on the T-Rex formation down climb into and step across the top of the Muetzel Chimney (5.6). Climb up the right side of the south wall following bolts to the summit of T-Rex. Crux move is above the first bolt (5.10a). Rappel 100 feet off bolts, no chains. PG = exposure and leads generally may be unsuited to someone transitioning from gym to outdoor climbing at the same rating.

 Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon, Vol. 2: Umpqua 2007, Map page 196 and Topo page 198.
content.protection: gear to 3 inches, Fixe SS 3/8" double expansion, no chains.
content.location: Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon, Vol. 2: Umpqua 2007, Map pages 194, 196, and Topo page 198.

content.description: Set up a belay on the false summit using gear to 3 inches. Down climb and step across the top of the Muetzel Chimney Crack (5.6), then climb or aid up the center following several 1/4" bolts to the summit. Rappel 100 feet off 3/8" bolts, no chains. PG = exposure and leads generally may be unsuited to someone transitioning from gym to outdoor climbing at the same rating. Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon, Vol. 2: Umpqua 2007 map page 196.
content.protection: gear to 3 inches, 1/4" high carbon steel bolts
content.location: Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon, Vol. 2: Umpqua 2007 maps pages 194, 196.

content.description: Climb east wall on the T-Rex formation starting to the right of the Muetzel Chimney, moving into the chimney as it opens up. This route is in need of cleaning and bolting.
content.protection: one 1/4 high carbon steel bolts plus gear of unknown size
content.location: Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon, Vol. 2: Umpqua 2007 maps pages 194, 196.

content.description: Pitch 1: Start at very bottom of rock in mossy section and mob up 160ft of bolts with one short crack of pro that uses one mid-large sized nut. Build an anchor using a few ~#1-3 cams at the top of the first summit. Belay anchors added 9/2020.Pitch 2: Downclimb 5.6 crack, stepping across the abyss. Have fun climbing across the chimney, don't poop your pants.Pitch 3: Climb last 60 ft to summit, last move is ~5.10a but safely protected with bolts. Would recommend bringing webbing for anchor, or another set of quick links as the rappel station causes lots of drag. Rappel chains added 9/2020.60 meter reaches ground from summit but will have lots of drag. A second rope gets you farther uphill and reduces drag.
content.protection: Bolted with nut placement on first pitch if nervous. Need cams to build the anchor at the top of the first summit.
content.location: Only obvious route at base of rock.
